The Miranda warning, those words we hear all the time on cop shows since 1964. You have the right to remain silent. If you give up that right, anything you say can and will be used... you get the point. I thought it was a good decision because, not only does it guarantee a suspect's rights, but also offers protection for the police to ensure that evidence has been obtained legally. Your thoughts?
